jsPlumb 2.1.0 includes support for editing StateMachine and Bezier connectors.

AdHoc Editing

Creating an Editable Connection

Using the connect method, you can create a Connection that is immediately editable:

var conn = jsPlumb.connect({
    source:"foo",
    target:"bar",
    editable:true
});

This will create a Connection that uses the edit defaults: dragging either element in the Connections discards edits, and the editor closes when the user clicks anywhere in the document (that is not part of the editor). Should you wish to change either of these settings, you'll need to provide an editParams object to the connect call:

var conn = jsPlumb.connect({
    source:"foo",
    target:"bar",
    editable:true,
    editParams:{
      clearOnDrag:false,
      closeOnMouseUp:false
    }
});
